topic.title: Feature request
topic.body: When i run two or more instances of ZeroNet it ends up in a crash and messing up each others configurations. It would be better to have a version which runs completely seperated from any existing ZeroNet instances.

1561542721_1KuQZvrUnzurrxTvTnjVzYXko33dV.body: I'm running ZeroNet on Linux but i'm writing a few decentralized apps for Windows that create zites on the fly and use ZeroNet in it's Appdata directory. If the end user has an instance of ZeroNet running the site gets also added into his/her directory as well.

> [geekless](#comment_60_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4): How does your app communicate with its private ZeroNet instance?

i'm using ZeroNet-win-dist\lib\ZeroNetZeroNet.cmd
